page.title: 11HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content:
The North-West corner is distinguished by the large Manor House known as Wotton House. The original brick home, bought by George Evelyn in l599, has been altered and added to many times. The Orangery was designed by William Kent. The old library was built by Nicholas Hawksmoor and in l864 the 'Gothic' library was added. This last is used for concerts and lectures now. There is now no visible trace of the original house which was Tudor.
The house has belonged to the Evelyn family for 400 years. The most famous Evelyn - John Evelyn of the Diary - laid out the gardens, which have in part survived. (The famous Diary was kept for 3 centuries at Wotton House,
